alert.note: Alert for Ford (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 23 at 4:28PM CDT until July 23 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHWESTERN FORD COUNTY... At 428 PM CDT, doppler radar indicated that thunderstorms have moved out of the warned area, and heavy rainfall has temporarily ended. Additional storms have begun to develop to the northwest, and they may impact the warned area within the next 1-2 hours, leading to additional flooding. HAZARD...Flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Rapid-onset flooding of small creeks and streams, roadways, underpasses, and poor drainage areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Gibson City, Melvin, Elliott and Sibley. Up to 4 inches of rain fell previously over far western Ford County. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
